author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board on Monday issued a notice asking the owners of private hospitals located in Chennai, Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur and Cuddalore districts, functioning without consent, to appear before the National Green Tribunal on January 6, in connection with a case.

The official release issued by TNPCB’s Member Secretary K. Karthikeyan stated that they have to appear before the Second Bench of the Southern Bench of the NGT in Arumbakkam at 10.30 a.m.. Else, the matter would be decided in their absence, he added. The notice was issued following a direction of the NGT to the TNPCB on December 23. Petitioner Jawaharlal Shanmugam had alleged there was lack of liquid biomedical waste treatment facilities in hospitals.

Applies to those in Chennai, Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur and Cuddalore districts functioning without consent
title: TNPCB asks hospital owners to appear before NGT
